clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Effects of a Structured Lifestyle Program
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Effects on Lifestyle Habits and Quality of Life in Individuals With Increased Cardiometabolic Risk Participating in a Structured Lifestyle Intervention Program

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study was to describe a structured intervention to reduce cardiovascular risk in a clinical setting and to study the effects of the program on lifestyle habits and quality of life in individuals at risk after six months and one year.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in waist circumference after one year
primary_outcome.description: change from baseline in waist circumference after one year

arm_group.description: The program consisted of an individual visit to a nurse for a health check-up and lifestyle counseling at baseline, six month and one year. The program also consisted of five group educations which included lectures on nicotine, alcohol, physical inactivity, eating habits, stress, sleeping habits and behavior changes

intervention.intervention_name: Longterm effects after a structured lifestyle program
intervention.description: present study was to describe a structured intervention to reduce cardiovascular risk in a clinical setting and to study the effects of the program on lifestyle habits and quality of life in individuals at risk after six months and one year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
(three risk factors )
- cardiovascular disease
- physical inactivity
- smoking
- risk consumption of alcohol
- unhealthy food habits
- stress
- overweight or abdominal obesity
- high lipids (cholesterol, LDL)
- high blood pressure
- diabetes/insulin resistance.
Exclusion criteria:
- Not understand Swedish language
